settings.subheading: How many times have you looked at your wardrobe and felt like you had nothing to wear? Have you ever spent hours in front of your suitcase not knowing what to pack for your next adventure? You’re definitely not alone. Thankfully, there is a solution:
settings.title: Say hello to capsule wardrobes!
settings.content:
You might have heard this term before; it was first introduced in the 1970s by English boutique owner Susie Faux and popularised in the 1980s by designer Donna Karan and her 7 Easy Pieces line. The concept is simple: versatile, high quality clothing that can be easily mixed and matched to create many different outfits. We like to think about a capsule wardrobe as a ‘tiny closet’ full of timeless, interchangeable pieces that you just love to wear. By buying intentionally and strategically, you can save money, space and time, while also saving the planet from unnecessary waste. Everyone wins!

.

GO STRAIGHT TO THE TRAVEL CAPSULE WARDROBE FORMULA

.

SO MANY CLOTHES, SO LITTLE TIME

Did you know we make around 35,000 decisions A DAY? Decision fatigue is an actual thing. And let’s be honest, if we go Marie Kondo on our closets, probably 80% of it won’t “spark joy”.  A capsule wardrobe forces us to have a more purposeful approach to our personal style and think about what we really like and what we actually use on our day-to-day. The result? A wardrobe full of versatile, interchangeable items that make you look like your best self. No more mornings wasted in front of the mirror trying to figure out what to wear, because any set you pick will look amazing!

TO EACH THEIR OWN: A CAPSULE WARDROBE FOR EVERY TASTE

The most important of capsule wardrobe rules? There aren’t any. You can follow any capsule wardrobe formula and tailor it specifically to your preferences. Take a work capsule wardrobe, for example. Whether you work from home, at an office, or out and about, you can create something to suit your needs. Whatever your style is, casual or elegant, minimal or bold, by choosing timeless basics and complimentary colours and patterns, you can mix and match your way to a wide variety of great outfits.

Apart from being sustainable and saving time and money, there’s another considerable benefit of capsule wardrobes: they can fit in small suitcases! For those of us who love travelling but hate the stress of packing, a travel capsule wardrobe is the perfect way to kiss our packing headaches goodbye.

settings.title: What’s a travel capsule wardrobe and why you absolutely NEED one
settings.content:
There’s a common misconception that packing light means wearing the same 2 boring outfits for the whole trip. We know (and have proof!) that does not have to be true. A well curated travel capsule, as any capsule wardrobe, will allow you to create countless outfits with just a few items, and you can always personalise it to your taste. Travel capsules focus on functionality, but that doesn’t mean you have to surrender your style. 

Why travel with a capsule wardrobe?

- Less items, less mess, less stress.
- Travel light: no more packing headaches (or backaches!)
- Laundry becomes much easier
- Better quality clothes that resist more and last longer
- Less waste and, therefore, a happier planet
- Save money (and spend on experiences instead)
- Less time to get ready in the morning, more time to explore
- Completely adaptable: build it according to your travelling needs, activities, destination climate and personal style

What are the travel capsule essentials and how many items should I take? 

There is no one set amount of clothing items that should be in a travel capsule wardrobe. This can vary according to the destination and the season. The most important thing is to find a magic number that works for YOU and fill your closet with clothes you love to wear all year round. We already found this magic number and the special formula for such a travel capsule wardrobe is right below. Keep on reading.

How much should I spend on a travel capsule wardrobe?

A capsule wardrobe does not have to be made of luxury items; it’s quite possible to fill your suitcase with affordable and good quality clothes. The amount you spend will be entirely up to you: your personal style, your favourite brands and how much you’re willing to invest. Most importantly, use what you already have and think twice before buying new!

Where can I buy a travel capsule wardrobe?

You can buy items individually and create your own capsule or, if you’re lacking inspiration and would prefer someone else to do the work for you, check out some of our premade capsule wardrobes here.

If you’re sold on the idea of building your own travel capsule wardrobe but don’t know where to start, read on for some of our foolproof formulas or head straightaway to our online capsule wardrobe creator by accessing Your Account in the top right corner.

settings.title: HOW TO START BUILDING YOUR TRAVEL CAPSULE WARDROBE?
settings.content:
There are a number of quite important aspects to take into consideration when building a travel capsule wardrobe. but we like to think of them in terms of a TRIP.
Here’s our magic TRIP formula:

settings.subheading: THE  " T R I P "  FORMULA

settings.content:
T - TIME - HOW LONG WILL YOU BE STAYING

Next major thing to consider: how many days is your trip? Depending on the duration of your travel, you’ll need to pack less or more - but how many items exactly should your travel capsule wardrobe have? It’s easy! Follow this 321 FORMULA to get your estimate and modify it according to your needs and itinerary (see point “I” below). Up to you how many extras you want to take and how much space you have left!

Want to see an example? Scroll down.

R - REGION - WHAT'S THE CLIMATE

First things first, research about your destination’s climate/weather and how it’s different from one season to another. Are you preparing a spring, summer or a fall, winter capsule wardrobe for your trip? What is the temperature like in your destination? Is it dry, wet, humid? Take all of this information into account. The colour palette of your travel capsule wardrobe will also depend on the weather at your final destination, i.e. take bright colours to the sunny destinations.

settings.title: Travel capsule wardrobe for hot destinations:
settings.paragraph: Rule of thumbs is to pack light, breathable summer clothes. As for the travel essentials to pack to hot destinations, make sure you take some warm layers for chilly evenings and colder nights. Extras to pack are head cover, likely a beach outfit and light rainwear in case of any surprise-rain. Think of the dry season and hot destinations like Thailand, Sri Lanka, Gambia, Kiribati or any other place on Earth with high temperatures and low precipitation.

settings.title: Travel capsule wardrobe for cold destinations:
settings.paragraph: Things to take into consideration are large temperature amplitudes. Be prepared to wear really light clothing during the day, ideally covering your skin, and throwing over you an extra warm layer when it gets chilly in the evening. Think of countries located in Western-North America, Southern-South America, Australia, Central and Southern Africa and much of Asia.

settings.title: Travel capsule wardrobe for dry climate:
settings.paragraph: Wet doesn’t necessarily mean that it will be rainy ALL the time, but be aware… it will be wet in between the rain time, pretty much all day long. That’s why your travel capsule wardrobe should definitely contain quick-dry clothes and a good waterproof jacket and/or umbrella for the sudden water splashes from the sky. Being wet, you might want to think of taking an extra layer of warm clothing in case you stay in dump clothes for too long.

settings.title: Travel capsule wardrobe for cold destinations:
settings.content: Ever heard of the onion layers? That’s the golden rule here! Make sure you equip your winter travel capsule with the proper amount of tops, long sleeves and sweaters. As for some winter extras to include in your carry-on luggage, keep your hat, scarf and gloves in your jacket and think of equipping yourself with the thermoactive underwear or merino wool legging and blouse as the base layer. Think of places like North of Europe in winter, Canada, Kazakhstan, Mongolia - just to name a few of them.

I - ITINERARY - WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING

Start here by planning the places you want to visit first then think about; what type of activities would you like to do? Are you planning on hiking? Swimming or just visiting the city?  Write down all of these notes for the planning of your capsule wardrobe, this would be helpful while you do your packing. For example; if you’re going on a hiking trip and spending most of your time in nature, you could pack more trousers than skirts and dresses. The activities and places you plan will determine the style and size of your travel capsule wardrobe. Rule of thumbs: pack those clothes which will be universal across city sightseeing, hiking in nature, rural areas and sport activities. Seems impossible? Read on.

P - PEOPLE - WHAT'S THE LOCAL CULTURE LIKE

An important aspect to pay attention to while building your travel capsule wardrobe is the local culture. Try to research about your destination’s culture before travelling there, this way you make sure that you stay respectful to the local people and not offend anyone. For example; you might need to pack modest clothing if you’re planning on visiting a conservative country like Egypt or visiting religious sites like mosques and churches.

settings.title: THE   " T R I P "   FORMULA IN PRACTICE.
settings.content:
HOW TO CHOOSE THE CLOTHES YOU’RE PACKING

After you’ve considered all the information above about your travel (climate, duration & activities), now comes the part where you’d actually pick which pieces of clothing you’re going to pack and choose for your travel capsule wardrobe. This might be the most challenging part for many people, but we’re going to help you make this process as smooth as possible with these little tips. 

WINTER

If you’re going on a trip in winter, you would need to pack more sweaters than shirts. As we know winter clothes tend to take up more space in our luggage than summer clothes. A little tip here that would be handy is wearing your chunkiest sweater or jacket to the airport during your travel. If it’s too hot, then just hold it and keep it with you during the flight.  Once you’ve arrived at your destination, you can wear it.

RECOMMENDED WINTER TRAVEL CAPSULE WARDROBE:

One-week- trip (6 pieces)
1 sweater + 2 long sleeves/shirts/blouses/t-shirts + 2 bottoms + 1 jacket/coat

Two-week (10pieces)
2 sweaters + 3 long sleeves/shirts/blouses/t-shirts +  3 bottoms + 1 knit dress + 1 jacket/coat

Three-week-trip (12 pieces)
2 sweaters + 4 long sleeves/shirts/blouses/t-shirts +  3 Bottoms + knit dresses + 1 jacket/coat

If your destination is extremely cold, make sure to pack thermal clothing that you could wear under your layers. We recommend mulesing-free merino wool as a perfect travel companion.  

SUMMER

In summer, the clothes are lighter and could fit more comfortably in your luggage. However in summer we tend to sweat more and therefore might need to wash our clothes more frequently than in winter.  A handy tip here would be to pay attention to the fabric of the clothes you’re packing, make sure it’s light and can dry quickly. Polyester, nylon, linen and merino wool are considered quick-dry fabrics. 

RECOMMENDED SUMMER CAPSULE WARDROBE:

One-week-Trip (6 pieces)
2 tank tops + 1 T-shirt/button down shirt + 2 bottoms + 1 dress +/- (1 light jacket/cardigan) 

Two-Week-Trip (10 pieces)
3 Tank Tops + 2 Shirts/button down shirt + 3 Bottoms + 2 Dresses +/- (1 light jacket/cardigan) 

Three-Week-Trip (12 pieces)
4 Tank Tops + 3 Shirts + 3 Bottoms + 2 Dresses +/- (1 light jacket/cardigan)

.

HOW TO CHOOSE THE SHOES YOU’RE PACKING

To decide on choosing the best shoes for your travel capsule wardrobe,  you could also follow the same criteria we mentioned above; which is considering the weather and the type of activities you want to engage in during your trip. 

For visiting a city during summer, sandals and sneakers would be the perfect choices. Are you planning on hiking? then swap the sneakers with your proper hiking shoes. If they’re too chunky, wear them during your flight so that they don’t take up much space in your luggage.  Do you plan on swimming and spending your trip next to the sea? Then pack some flip-flops along with the other shoes.

As for when travelling through winter make sure to pack some good boots that will keep you warm. You could also add some sneakers which could be the shoes you wear during your flight there. Also, don't forget some extra warm socks.

WHAT ABOUT TOILETRIES?

As you might already know, if you’re travelling with only carry-on luggage, there are some rules when it comes to packing toiletries. You’re limited to liquids that are less than 100ml and all liquids containers must fit in a (transparent) bag with a total capacity of 1 litre. This might sound very limiting but we have a couple of tips that would help. 

Try to minimise the toiletries you pack by only packing the essentials. This might be different from one person to another but here are the most popular: soap, toothpaste, toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner, deodorant, SPF cream, face/body moisturiser cream,  body wash, hand sanitizer, a comb, a razor and some different make-up products. The list can go on of course, but what you do is start by eliminating anything that you can live without.

We recommend considering a swap from liquid cosmetics packed in plastic bottles to solid cosmetics for more zero-waste way of living. There are many options for solid shampoo, deodorant and toothpaste. Another thing you can try is checking the toiletries your accommodation is offering, as many of them offer soap, shampoo and conditioners. This way you can save more space in your toiletries bag.

settings.title: ULTIMATE TRAVEL CAPSULE FORMULA
settings.content:
See? Packing doesn’t have to be a nightmare! Now you’re all ready to build your affordable travel capsule wardrobe and explore the world sustainably and worry free. All you need to remember are these key takeaways:

1 | There are NO RULES if it comes to Capsule Wardrobes, except one: it needs to serve YOUR needs. It doesn't matter how much time or money you spend or how many items you pick. Simply make it work for YOU.

2 | Review your current wardrobe and focus on choosing timeless basics and complimentary colours and patterns, so that you can mix and match your way to a wide variety of great outfits. Choose QUALITY over QUANTITY.

3 | Follow our magic T R I P formula to build your own travel capsule wardrobe. Analyse the Time and length of your travel, the Region and climate you travel to, the Itinerary you planned and consider local People and their culture.

4 | To calculate exact quantities of items needed, follow our golden 321 formula. Create the base of 3 TOPS, 2 BOTTOMS and 1 EXTRA and then multiply the base by amount of weeks you travel.

5 | Complement and substitute the elements you pack. Be open to make compromises or swaps. Pack the absolute minimum first and when some space is left, start adding items in their priority order.
